discourse_list.title: MIP41c4-SP33: Events Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - Jon Perry (EVENTS-001)

content.content: MIP41c4-SP33: Events Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - Jon Perry  Preamble MIP41c4-SP#: 33 Author(s): @PonJerry Contributors: Tags: core-unit, cu-events-001, facilitator, active Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-03-09 Date Ratified: 2022-04-25 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip41c4-sp33-events-core-unit-facilitator-onboarding-jon-perry-events-001/13775 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmSVzGcm   Sentence Summary This subproposal onboards Jon Perry as the Facilitator for EVENTS-001.  Paragraph Summary This sub roposal onboards Jon Perry as the Facilitator for EVENTS-001.  As the facilitator, he will be responsible for ensuring the Events CU achieves its mandate of producing branded events for MakerDAO to the highest level of quality, transparency and professionalism.  Specification  Motivation The creation of the Events Core Unit brings a new and exciting time for myself and our team.  I want to bring my extensive skills and experience to help push MakerDAO into the next phase of growth.  I believe branded events will play a key role in this growth.  The recent DAIvinity event at ETH Denver showed just how powerful a MakerDAO event can be for the DAO and Maker community. The potential for impact of these events is extremely beneficial and by working closely with other CU’s we can ensure this CU plays a critical role in MakerDAO’s future.  By acting as the facilitator of the Events CU I can use my experience, skills and drive to lead the team responsible for this success at DAIvinity toward our vision and mandate outline in MIP39c2-SP32.  Core Unit ID EVENTS-001  Facilitator name and information Name: Jon Perry Forum: @PonJerry Discord: PonJerry#9290 ETH Wallet Address: 0x9A214CE4c8D490C78bF083939f0e0f3D9e523A56  Facilitator Commitment As a Facilitator, my commitment will be to keep the Events Core Unit running smoothly. The daily tasks may include:  Being the Facilitator and Mechanical Engineer of the Events Core Unit Ensure smooth execution of all event-related activities Communication with other CU’s to gain input into event locations and incorporation of product launch into the event theme Being the main interface between Governance and MakerDAO Community Support the Community and CU by providing and executing various technical tasks Communicating Core Unit’s work progress and results Maintaining transparency in work, tasks, and any updates done by and within the Core Unit Ensure the CU team is properly equipped, funded and supported   Facilitator Credentials  Experience  https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathan-perry-91591449/ Senior Mechanical/Industrial Engineer with 10 plus years in product development, design and manufacturing Creating, executing and maintaining 5 million+ project budgets Team lead for dozens of product development projects, providing management, guidance and direction for team members Last 7 years  working for business development of a global engineering and manufacturing company Owned and managed 2 guitar manufacturing businesses, Jon Perry Guitars & El Rollo Guitars   Extensive experience designing LED lighting systems Design LED lighting fixtures for the mass transit industry including Headlights, Interior Main Lighting, Interior & Exterior Indicator Lights, Control Systems and Decorative Lights Extensive experience in woodworking, CNC programming and operation
content.GPT-summary: This post is a subproposal for onboarding Jon Perry as the Facilitator for EVENTS-001, a Core Unit responsible for producing branded events for MakerDAO. The author explains the motivation behind the proposal and the potential impact of branded events for MakerDAO's growth. The post also includes the facilitator's commitment and credentials. A 3rd party gives entirely positive feedback on the proposal and extends support to the Core Unit.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: 3F Delegate had the pleasure of meeting Jon (assuming its the same Jon  ) at EthDenver and I can say that his dedication, hard work, and focus helped to make the DAIvinity come into fruition. Our conversations lead us to believe that Jon also understand the concept of decentralization and the importance of marketing MakerDAO as the premier protocol of DeFi. He is open-minded and we believe he will welcome any advice that you as a community member believe will help MakerDAO stay marketable and innovative. However, I don’t believe we expanded on @PonJerry ability to book Talent needed to showcase an event–Jon can you please expand on that? Also, would it be possible to monetize Events sometime down the road? We see folks like Solana charging $380 per person for their next nightclub event in Miami this coming April.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Hi @flipflopflapdelegate , thank you for your kind words and it was a pleasure meeting you at ETHDenver. So just to clear things up @PonJerry  will be taking on the governance roll for the events team. Yes we are both named John/Jon which is comically confusing to say the least. I’ll go by Legg (my last name) to save everyone the hassle. I’ll let @PonJerry introduce himself to you all and talk you through his roll with the events team. As far as monetizing the Maker events, this is absolutely possible in the future. I believe that given a few more professionally executed events coordinated with my team, Maker events will cement itself as “THE Go-to event”. This will bring huge monetizing potential which will then lower our overall budget.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Thank you for your support @flipflopflapdelegate.  As @Leggevents mentioned there are two of us to confuse everyone.  We did briefly meet at ETH Denver but the more extensive conversations you had were with Legg. @Leggevents did a fantastic job putting DAIvinity together and communicating with the Maker team to pull everything together. I was equally involved but more in the background handling the technical aspects of the event, so less known to most people at the moment. Let us also touch on @Leggevents ability to book and curate talent as credit is due on this aspect.  Legg managed to create and execute an event under an extremely short timeline.  He was able to leverage his connections to bring together an all-star crew that contained expertise in visual animation, LED lighting and branding.  The international artist also curated were fantastic and you could see the positive reaction of the attendees. Moving forward as a CU we have determined the best structure is for me to be the facilitator for two reasons.  The first is my background is better suited to navigate the governance side and financial/budget aspects of the CU.  The second is 2-3weeks leading up to events the workload of the event manager is extensive and could create conflict between the immediate needs of the event and any governance work.  Having myself as the facilitator allows @Leggevents to have full focus on the upcoming event while in parallel I can handle anything required on the governance and community side. The proposal for monetizing events is a great suggestion and something that can be implemented in the future.  After a series of free events to get the Maker name established transitioning to a hybrid of free and monetized is a good direction.  This could allow the CU to generate an income to offset the financial burden on the DAO.  I would be interested to hear/see what a $380 Solana is like.  If you are going to the event or know anyone going please take some pics and some videos!
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Reminder that this proposal will enter its Frozen Period in one week, on March 31, 2022. Last day for modifications is March 30, 2022. Substantive modifications beyond that date will render the proposal ineligible for the upcoming Governance Cycle / reset its Frozen Period, as the case may be. Reach out if you have any questions!
